items.content:
React Native Engineer

Posted Jun 1

FullStack
Headquarters: Iowa City, IA
http://gofullstack.com/jobs/
View all FullStack jobs →

We need an experienced, passionate, and motivated React Native engineer who can jump in and take ownership of our challenging mobile engineering projects. Our native mobile products interact deeply with RESTful API backends, so knowledge of web application architectures and technologies is a plus.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Drive the holistic development of our mobile applications, from architecture, to coding,  to deployment.  
  • Build mobile applications using React Native + Redux
  • Ownership in developing and improving all aspects of our stack (development, testing, CI, automation, and architecture)
  • Deploy to both iOS and Android (Apple App Store, Google Play Store)
  • Writing functional, well-tested code.App layout and user interface development
  • Designing and engineering features that deliver value to the people who use them. This means collaborating closely with the entire team (designers, product managers, etc.) 
  • Refactoring, paying down technical debt, etc.

Let’s Have A Chat If You…
  • Have developed React Native apps that communicate with Restful APIs, use local storage, network data synchronization, and user authentication. 
  • Enjoy working with React Native and have a successful track record of developing both iOS and Android applications using this framework.
  • Love programming with ES6 syntax.
  • Have integrated with native hardware components in a React Native app.
  • Understand and have experience making decisions about mobile application architecture, including data modeling, networking and data synchronization, and concurrency.
  • Are competent with developing application interfaces for multiple device types based off of mockups.
  • Strive to automate everything you do - from sending out builds to running tests. 
  • Are equally comfortable working with HTTP-based web services, and have a working knowledge of web application and API architectures.
  • Have an appreciation for the peace of mind that comes with well-tested, documented code.
  • Are excited by the web and keep up with new technologies and that excitement is infectious.
  • Communicate well with others in both written and verbal forms
  • Are self-directed and able to manage your time effectively

Bonus points for…
  • iOS or Android development experience using Objective-C, Swift, or Android
  • Ruby on Rails development experience. 
  • Knowing your way around XCode or Android Studio
  • Familiarity using Expo to build React Native apps
  • Experience working with an agile / scrum-based development model
  • A BS or MS in Computer Science or, Math or another analytic discipline
  • Previous history of working with a remote, distributed team
  • Significant contributions to or ownership of open source projects (please do tell!)

Other information about this position
  • Working remotely is how we operate

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: beginner

COMPANY: Thingthing SL; 25-50 employees; 25-50% remote;

We are Fleksy and we believe the future will be one where switching between apps on your mobile will be old stuff. That's why we are building the next big keyboard from sunny Barcelona.

Do you want to work in an environment with real values? So check out our 4 core values:

Transparency: this is the foundation of trust and we think it should be the same between all humans
Reliability: we build outstanding products you can trust, and love to use every single day
Authenticity: we listen before we act to offer the best solution, even if it's recommending our competition
Fairness: behaving the way we want to be treated creates trust, and we promote it every day
If you share and feel the same values, keep reading! Right now we are looking for a new member to join our tech team. As a Senior Android Developer, you will develop an app used by millions of people all over the world by:

Building Fleksy in a beautiful city with a small team atmosphere.
Share your mobile skills and experience with the company
Contribute to the company’s culture
Help develop the next big thing in messaging

Main requirements

University degree in Computer Science or a related field
At least 3 years experience in Android development
Knowledge of C/C++
Experience with Android NDK
You have shipped multiple Android titles and can provide samples of your work
Experience publishing on Google Play Store
Use of Android Studio and Java/Kotlin
Experience working with Git environments
Android application architecture and design
Knowledge of MVC/MVP design patterns, OOP and development best practices
Experience integrating and managing 3rd party apps
Writing and shipping quality and testable code
Confident communicator in English
Comfortable working in an Agile environment
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team
Team player
Structured and autonomous

Nice to have

React/Dagger
Python
JavaScript
Algorithms and data structures (CLRS/TAOCP/Big-O notation)
Application performance and tuning (memory, CPU, battery life)
Experience with caching approaches
Data-oriented development skills (analytics, A/B testing, Unit Testing, etc.)
Experience in a startup environment
Experience in design UX/UI

Perks

Weekly team lunch
Free coffee, water and occasional goodies
Access to our vast network of mentors and advisors
Option to be rewarded with stock options
Team building activities
Opportunity to work in an award-winning product used by almost 1 Milion users
Great office space in the beautiful, active and multicultural neighborhood of Gràcia in the center of Barcelona
Opportunity to interact with the Betahaus community and attend their interesting events

items.title: Contract: React Native Engineer at FullStack in Anywhere USA
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=53, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=15, apple=22, java=5, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=62}
items.content:
We need an experienced, passionate, and motivated React Native engineer who can jump in and take ownership of our challenging mobile engineering projects. Our native mobile products interact deeply with RESTful API backends, so knowledge of web application architectures and technologies is a plus

Primary Responsibilities

  • Drive the holistic development of our mobile projects, from architecture, to coding, to deployment.
  • Build mobile applications using React Native + Redux
  • Ownership in developing and improving all aspects of our stack (development, testing, CI, automation, and architecture)
  • Deploy to both iOS and Android (Apple App Store, Google Play Store)
  • Writing functional, well-tested code
  • App layout and user interface development
  • Designing and engineering features that deliver value to the people who use them. This means collaborating closely with the entire team (designers, product managers, etc.)
  • Refactoring, paying down technical debt, etc.

About FullStackOur mission is to make our clients incredibly successful by developing and improving ideas into highly functional and usable web applications. Our team has become renowned in our ability to bring creativity, expertise, and sound development practices to notable and ambitious startups. Our development work focuses on architecting and building new applications as well as scaling existing apps for our clients as they grow.

Let’s Have A Chat If You…

  • Have developed React Native apps that communicate with Restful APIs, use local storage, network data synchronization, and user authentication.
  • Enjoy working with React Native and have a successful track record of developing both iOS and Android applications using this framework.
  • Love programming with ES6 syntax.
  • Have integrated with native hardware components in a React Native app.
  • Understand and have experience making decisions about mobile application architecture, including data modeling, networking and data synchronization, and concurrency.
  • Are competent with developing application interfaces for multiple device types based off of mockups.
  • Strive to automate everything you do - from sending out builds to running tests.
  • Are equally comfortable working with HTTP-based web services, and have a working knowledge of web application and API architectures.
  • Have an appreciation for the peace of mind that comes with well-tested, documented code.
  • Are excited by the web and keep up with new technologies and that excitement is infectious.
  • Communicate well with others in both written and verbal forms
  • Are self-directed and able to manage your time effectively

Bonus points for…

  • iOS or Android development experience using Objective-C, Swift, or Android
  • Ruby on Rails development experience.
  • Knowing your way around XCode or Android Studio
  • Familiarity using Expo to build React Native apps
  • Experience working with an agile / scrum-based development model
  • A BS or MS in Computer Science or, Math or another analytic discipline
  • Previous history of working with a remote, distributed team
  • Significant contributions to or ownership of open source projects (please do tell!)

Other information about this position

  • Working remotely is how we operate
  • This is a contract position, with up to 40 hours per week
  • Work visa transfer or sponsorship is not possible at this time
  • We are looking for people located within the continental United States

items.content:
iOS Developer

Posted May 29

X-Team
Headquarters: Remote
https://x-team.com/remote-ios-developer-jobs/?utm_source=weworkremotely&utm_medium=board&utm_campaign=wwr-q4-18
View all X-Team jobs →

About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary teams of developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live.

We are also a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. We’ve fostered a unique, active lifestyle and culture around this idea that continues to attract thousands of developers to apply every day.

What separates us from our competition is the level of attention and care we give our developers compared to other more "talent"-based solutions. We proactively support them, fund their learning and growth, connect them in roaming hacker houses around the world, and give them a remote environment that motivates and inspires them on a daily basis. While other companies simply place and drop their talent, we provide unified teams of developers centered around the same beliefs, values and lifestyle.

We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age and aid them in being able to do so properly with the right people.

About You:
The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.

Most important:
- 3+ years of experience in mobile iOS Development
- Experience with Objective-C, CSS, Javascript, HTML
- Experience with JSON, XML, SOAP, REST
- Experience with server side technologies (Java, NodeJS, PHP)
- Experience storing and indexing data
- Knowledge of Swift and Xcode
- Code optimization and performance improvements
- Write well designed, testable, efficient code

Nice to have:
- Experience with working remotely
- Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

Personal:
- Independent, self-motivated
- Fluent in English, written and spoken
- Proven track record of always learning and growing.
- Proactive attitude
- Possess a spirit of generosity

Perks:
- Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.
- Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world. http://x-outpost.com
- Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
- Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to learn new skills together in study groups, join clubs (photography, gaming, etc.) and get free camera equipment/games/conferences/courses/massages/etc., charitable fundraisers, fitness & yoga programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.
- We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. (http://x-team.com/unleash)

FAQ:
Who is X-Team meant for?
- Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

What are you hiring for right now?
- We are hiring for PHP developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We're also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

Will I get a job immediately after applying?
- If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

What kind of opportunities do you provide?
- We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

Apply for this position

Apply here: https://x-team.com/remote-ios-developer-jobs/?utm_source=weworkremotely&utm_medium=board&utm_campaign=wwr-q4-18

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=26, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=18, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About
-----
We are Sonicjobs, a revolutionary Virtual Recruiter that is changing the way people find local jobs and candidates. Every day we help hundreds of managers hire the right people for their business and people find the right job, instantly. Our apps combine the skills of a recruiter with the power of an online job board.

The role
--------
We are currently looking for an iOS Software Engineer to join our team and contribute to the evolution of our fast growing platform. The person covering the role is passionate about programming, knowledgeable about design patterns, curious about experimenting the best mobile interaction solutions and the most efficient mobile architectures. We are a distributed team and therefore an extremely good attitude to communication is also needed.
You'll be working on a mobile app powered by machine learning logic. We use agile methodologies and release frequently.

Skills
---------------
* Strong knowledge of iOS SDK, Swift
* Apps deployed to the iTunes Store
* Strong understanding of design patterns and Object Oriented Programming
* Solid knowledge of iOS UI/UX design principles, patterns and best practices
* Solid knowledge of Auto Layout, Storyboards, XIBs
* In-depth experience of working with RESTful APIs
* Capable of writing robust, clean code
* Experience working in an Agile Scrum environment and collaborative tools (e.g Jira)
* Understanding of build processes and CI tooling (e.g. Jenkins, Fastlane)
* Experience with Instruments and advanced debugging
* Experience with the iTunesConnect release process
* Experience with Unit/UI testing (e.g. XCTest, Appium, Nimble, OHHttpStubs)
* Knowledge of Objective-C is a plus
* Excellent communication skills

Opportunity
-----------
We are an easy going and focused startup team iterating on a validated and promising idea currently backed by a set of successful investors with a long experience in the sector. The platform will soon be scaling worldwide.
We are based in London, Finsbury Square.
This is a full-time permanent position.

items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

Posted May 26

Joya Communications, Inc.
Headquarters: Palo Alto
http://www.getjoya.com
View all Joya Communications, Inc. jobs →

Senior Software Engineer (Mobile Features)

We're looking for a thoughtful and creative client engineer to join our team. You are someone who feels pride from writing solid code, you enjoy creating new user experiences and solving fun technical problems. You delight in making a difference for millions of people in the world and you care about having a joyful work environment.

You will:

  • Collaborate with teammates to implement and launch highly visible, user-facing features from start to finish
  • Produce solid quality code, raising the bar for the whole team on quality and speed
  • Work with one or more of Swift, ObjectiveC, Java, Kotlin, C++ and/or Python

You may be a fit if you:

  • Have effective interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills to work successfully in a 100% remote team environment
  • Pride yourself on strong foundation in computer science, data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Are looking for a joyful work environment where you and your teammates look forward to coming to work
  • Are humble and intellectually curious
A bit about us... we're on the mission to help people feel close. Our app, Marco Polo® is already reaching millions of people — we're top of charts on iOS and Play Store. We're a distributed, small team, that cares about working joyfully and making a difference in the world.

Does this sound interesting to you? If so, then we'd love to hear from you. We care deeply about diversity and inclusion at Joya. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We can add teammates from anywhere in the US.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to developing, releasing, monitoring and maintaining native Android applications. Applicants are also expected to participate in after-hours work.

All candidates will have

  • a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study
  • a minimum of two years' experience developing, monitoring and troubleshooting native Android applications with significant interaction with backend systems
  • expert level knowledge and hands-on experience with Java and the Android SDK
  • experience collaborating with UI/UX designers
  • excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities
  • excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

Ideally, candidates will also have

  • experience with RxJava or other asynchronous and event-based paradigms
  • experience with Kotlin
  • experience with at least one backend language such as Go, C/C++, Java and Scala

Apply for this position

If you are interested in this position please apply here https://www.numbrs.com/de/careers/open-positions/details#orYE7fwU

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
Ukraine
Russia
Belarus
Brazil
Estonia
Latvia
Poland
Argentina
Bulgaria

EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Acromax Technology GmbH; 50-75 employees; 50-75% remote;

We are looking for talented Android developers for our own in-house projects.

The project is developed natively in Java. It is about a sophisticated hybrid app which merges video, audio, images and social media into one single place for the consumer. Part of the app are customized players, intelligent caching and offline availability of media data, social media features and a super modern UI with a great UX design.

We are currently looking for talented developers on the global market to be a part of our team of developers, currently located in offices in Hamburg, Berlin, San Francisco and Rio de Janeiro. In addition, we are also open to opportunities for hiring developers from other cities around the globe to work remote on our devices.

The project offers a series of challenges for being an iterative process, where we are always implementing and experimenting with features in a fast-paced environment. That promotes growth by giving you the responsibility to be always contributing with code that impacts directly the user experience.

Technically, some of the main challenges involve dealing with multiple sources of media playback, managing and improving the many ways users can interact with these media (which are also conditioned by media types and app context, and maintaining and evolving the architecture, aiming to guarantee code that is well structured, solid and as accessible as possible for new developers, despite continually being changed by our iterative process.

items.title: Kickass iOS developer - Build cool stuff with seez at Seez (Beirut, Lebanon)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=22, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=12, ruby=0, apple=16, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Machine Learning, Marketplace, Mobile Application
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

iosswiftobjective-c

Job description

Be a part of a growing startup and join us in changing how people buy cars

We at seez, are looking for a kickass ios developer. Preferably someone with swift experience, but we understand that a good obj-c dev can easily transition to swift as that is 100% of our code right now.

You will be a part of a distributed team in the middle east and europe, with possibility to work anywhere in the world, though we would love to have you at one of our offices. Your role will be to help make a great product that many people will use and love. You will have freedom, you will be challenged, you will not be shut down due to bureacracy, your voice will be heard. Note that this job listing is preferably for someone located in Beirut to fill up our office there, however if you are exceptional, we will consider otherwise. We are not looking for a freelancer. If you are further than +/-  3 timezones from UTC+1, please don't apply, we highly value communication, you are not a code monkey

We use slack extensively and employ very little hierarchy, you are free to speak your mind, come up with ideas and be a part of our community. Even though Seez is a startup, and funds are limited, we value our employees highly and acknowledge that a great developer should be paid a competitive salary

 

Our ideal candiate has the following characteristics

  • A passion for writing first-class frontend code.
  • A minimum of 4 years of experience as a iOS developer. Your education is less important than your ability to challenge yourself and write code (We’d rather see a beautiful GitHub profile than a fancy degree).
  • You care greatly about code quality.
  • You take pride in what you do, but welcome feedback.
  • Prior experience in working with Scrum and, or Agile methodologies.
  • Good communication skills and willingness to work in a team.
  • Speaks english extremely well
  • A lot of good ideas and are constantly following the latest trends and ways.


We value growing our team and there will be plenty of oppurtunities for you to jump into our other projects and get familar with for example machine learning or developing an API

If you're interested

Send a few words about yourself and why you’re a right match for the position along with your CV.

Apply now
Ask a question

About Seez

Seez was founded in 2016 and in June 2018 got funded with $1.8M. Seez  develops and maintains the app Seez R, currently available in the United Arab Emirates. Our main vision is to ease the time spent for consumers to find their dream car, mostly through visibility, aggregation and automation.

We heavily focus on software and most of our team members are software developers or coming from math related fields.

Benefits

  • Work anywhere
  • Unlimited Paid Vacation
  • Competitive salary
  • Be a part of a community
  • Heavy start-up culture in a stable organization
  • Paid coworking space (if remote) or office
  • Strong peers to learn from
  • This perk is only here to have an even number of perks

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Real Estate
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

swiftmvvmreact-nativecore-dataobjective-c

Job description

Who Is Follow Up Boss?

  • We’re a SaaS solution for real estate teams to better manage their leads.
  • We’re a bootstrapped, profitable company started back in April of 2011
  • We’re a remote company with a mostly US-based team
  • We don’t just claim to be customer-centric - we live it:https://www.facebook.com/followupboss/reviews

    Checkout our video on how we work: https://followupboss-1.wistia.com/medias/kc5ows18dj

    Our mobile apps:
    iOS: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/follow-up-boss/id966131499?mt=8
    Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.followupboss.fubandroidclient&hl=en

Why Would You Want To Work Here?

  • We’re a young, ambitious company who only answers to our customers
  • Opportunity to have a big impact on our growth and your career
  • No red tape or pointless meetings
  • Competitive base salary, health/dental insurance and 20 days paid holiday

This Role Is For You If…

  • You would describe yourself as patient, empathetic and having a good sense of humour
  • You’re independent, self-motivated and can stay efficient and productive without someone looking over your shoulder all day long
  • Superb written and verbal skills (with a professional yet fun demeanor)

Your qualifications:

  • Self motivated and proactive mindset.
  • Remote work experience is considered an asset.
  • Based in the USA, quiet home office with fast internet.
  • Expert in Swift., familiarity with Objective-C a plus.
  • Expertise in package management systems (e.g. CocoaPods and Carthage).
  • Experience with core iOS technologies including UIKit, Auto Layout, Grand Central Dispatch, ARC, push notifications, and others.
  • Experience submitting an app to the AppStore, managing certificates, and navigating the app review process.
  • Strong understanding of threading and asynchronous programming
  • Experience with MVVM architecture.
  • Experience writing unit tests.
  • Experience with Core Data.
  • Experience using Instruments.
  • Familiarity with functional reactive programming (FRP) a plus.
  • Familiarity with a reactive framework like ReactiveSwift or RXSwift a plus.
  • Experience with hybrid app development a plus (e.g. React Native).
  • Expertise in version control systems (git).
  • Proven ability to create/contribute to robust commercial applications.
  • Exceptional time management skills.
  • Attention to detail and commitment to quality.
  • Security conscious.
  • Successful track record of working remotely.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Help drive mobile development forward, improving the quality of our mobile apps and the experience our users get from them.
  • Mentor other team members.
  • Monthly customer hero day (spend a day on the front lines once per month to truly understand our customers).

30 Day Targets:

  • Become familiar with our mobile apps (iOS and Android) and their codebases.
  • Become familiar with our API, which the mobile apps communicate with.
  • Pair with mobile engineers to gain knowledge about the system and how we work.
  • Improve the new hire onboarding process, by being a part of it.

60 Day Targets:

  • Take part in improving the email features for our customers daily workflow
  • Building and releasing our integrated calling solution on mobile (we use Twilio)

90 Day Targets:

  • Assist in improving the performance of both iOS and Android apps.
  • Continue improving our iPhone app to be a 5 star experience for our customers.
  • Engage with customers and work to better drive users to newer versions of our mobile apps.

Our Core Engineering Values

  • Teamwork
  • Communication
  • Code Quality
  • Focus and Prioritization
  • Customer Driven
  • Leadership Qualities

If this sounds like a great fit we would love to hear from you,.

We're not accepting applications from agencies. 

Apply now

About Follow Up Boss

Our CRM is quite powerful under the hood and allows many various services to integrate with us through our API. Working here, there are always interesting problems to tackle. For example, we monitor tens of thousands of email mailboxes and process emails in the hundreds of millions. 

Benefits

  • Fully Remote
  • Competitive Salary
  • Health and Dental
  • 20 days paid holiday
  • Monthly gift cards for coffee, books, food, charity, fitness and more

items.content:
High response rate

This company responds to the majority of applications it receives.

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Architecture, Construction, Design
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

ioscocoaobjective-cswiftxcode

Job description

WHAT ARE YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

You will lead development of the app and have the ability to write highly performant code. You will rapidly prototype and work closely with our designers to iterate through multiple phases of user testing, while also working closely with developers across all teams (particularly the cloud devs).

As an iOS Engineer, you will tackle difficult and interesting challenges for the iOS app with enthusiasm. Particularly related to:

  • Creating real-time collaboration and markup software for construction documents.
  • Work closely with the other Bullclip clients to ensure the functionality is consistent and integrates with all platforms.
  • Participation in design workshops and feature kick-offs to ensure we are working towards an achievable development goal.
  • Build and iterate quickly on new features to optimise user value as quickly as possible.
  • Building slick and responsive UI that can handle millions of user-generated data points (like photos and annotations)
  • Utilizing native iOS tools to develop an experience that can effectively replace pen and paper workflows (both iPad and iPhone) for an industry that desperately needs it.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO DRAWBOARD:

Proficient mid-level to senior developer with a passion for building functional and high quality software. 

  • At least three years iOS experience.
  • Experience with Swift.
  • Experience with Xcode.
  • Experienced senior developer (or very talented mid-level) who has strong knowledge of system architecture.
  • Worked in a collaborative environment prior to this that demonstrates an ability to work well in teams and have one or more quality apps on the App Store.
  • Working knowledge of complex mathematics (particularly around transformation matrices).
  • Extensive experience with Cocoa Touch Framework.
  • A passion of modern design patterns.
  • General experience developing responsive asynchronous apps.

Bonus points if you have:

  • Experience with Objective C.
  • Android development experience.
  • ReactNative development experience.
  • Prior experience working at a startup.
  • A degree in computer science or mathematics.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:

  • A competitive salary
  • Remote working arrangements
  • The opportunity to lead a growing mobile team
  • A talented team of  passionate technical people
  • An easy-going, social environment. You really need to see the office and meet the people!
  • A rare chance to develop for the latest Apple hardware, particularly around touch and Pencil.
Apply now
Ask a question

About Drawboard

Drawboard is a Melbourne based company that specialises in developing powerful, simple and collaborative PDF technologies. Our flagship product, Drawboard PDF, has enjoyed great success and global adoption on the Windows platform, and we are busy developing a real-time collaboration platform, Bullclip, tailored for Design and Construction projects. The Bullclip platform currently includes a Web app, a UWP app and an iOS app developed with a focus on touch and pen technologies.  

Drawboard is a nimble company (less than 20 people) with ambitions to grow and be a key player in the construction technology space by developing fast, innovative and easy to use products designed with the user top of mind.

People enjoy working here because we're working on something meaningful and industry changing, have lots of creative freedom and enjoy working within a talented team.

Benefits

  • Flexible time and hardware arrangements
  • Mobile and Web App Development
  • Relaxed startup culture
  • Wear what you want
  • Significant say in company matters
  • Close-knit team
  • Right in the heart of Melbourne
  • Bar fridge, fruit

items.title: FullStack: React Native Engineer (Contract)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=61, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=15, apple=22, java=5, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=70}
items.content:
Part-time

(Anywhere)

React Native Engineer (Contract)

We need an experienced, passionate, and motivated React Native engineer who can jump in and take ownership of our challenging mobile engineering projects. Our native mobile products interact deeply with RESTful API backends, so knowledge of web application architectures and technologies is a plus. 

Primary Responsibilities

  • Drive the holistic development of our mobile projects, from architecture, to coding,  to deployment.  
  • Build mobile applications using React Native + Redux
  • Ownership in developing and improving all aspects of our stack (development, testing, CI, automation, and architecture)
  • Deploy to both iOS and Android (Apple App Store, Google Play Store)
  • Writing functional, well-tested code.
  • App layout and user interface development 
  • Designing and engineering features that deliver value to the people who use them. This means collaborating closely with the entire team (designers, product managers, etc.) 
  • Refactoring, paying down technical debt, etc.

About FullStack

Our mission is to make our clients incredibly successful by developing and improving ideas into highly functional and usable web applications. Our team has become renowned in our ability to bring creativity, expertise, and sound development practices to notable and ambitious startups. Our development work focuses on architecting and building new applications as well as scaling existing apps for our clients as they grow.

Let’s Have A Chat If You…

  • Have developed React Native apps that communicate with Restful APIs, use local storage, network data synchronization, and user authentication. 
  • Enjoy working with React Native and have a successful track record of developing both iOS and Android applications using this framework.
  • Love programming with ES6 syntax.
  • Have integrated with native hardware components in a React Native app.
  • Understand and have experience making decisions about mobile application architecture, including data modeling, networking and data synchronization, and concurrency.
  • Are competent with developing application interfaces for multiple device types based off of mockups.
  • Strive to automate everything you do - from sending out builds to running tests. 
  • Are equally comfortable working with HTTP-based web services, and have a working knowledge of web application and API architectures.
  • Have an appreciation for the peace of mind that comes with well-tested, documented code.
  • Are excited by the web and keep up with new technologies and that excitement is infectious.
  • Communicate well with others in both written and verbal forms
  • Are self-directed and able to manage your time effectively

Bonus points for…

  • iOS or Android development experience using Objective-C, Swift, or Android
  • Ruby on Rails development experience. 
  • Knowing your way around XCode or Android Studio
  • Familiarity using Expo to build React Native apps
  • Experience working with an agile / scrum-based development model
  • A BS or MS in Computer Science or, Math or another analytic discipline
  • Previous history of working with a remote, distributed team
  • Significant contributions to or ownership of open source projects (please do tell!)

Other information about this position

  • Working remotely is how we operate
  • This is a contract position, with up to 40 hours per week
  • Work visa transfer or sponsorship is not possible at this time
  • We are looking for people located within the continental United States

Apply: Please include a copy of your resume, and any portfolio items (github, app store, etc) that you would like to share with us.

items.content:
About Monese


At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.
Monese serves hundreds of thousands of customers in the UK and Europe, and we are adding new services on a regular basis.
Our fast growing team is located in London, UK and Tallinn, Estonia. By working with us, you will be part of a carefully selected team who are great at what they do and share the belief in our mission of making banking available to everybody. We’re not just a start-up with an idea; we have a proven business model that is growing exponentially and generates strong revenues.



About the role


We are looking for an Android Developer focused on growth related features and projects, someone who possesses a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits and will participate in driving our already successful banking service to new heights. You will be a member of a seasoned, cross-functional team of developers, analysts, designers and growth hackers tasked with growing usage of our mobile product.
If taking on a big part of the responsibility for making Monese the most innovative banking account in the world doesn’t scare you and you want to file patents not follow trends then read on…


We are looking for you, if you have:


* Proven commercial experience in Android app development
* Experience working in an Agile environment, as well as with Android Studio
* Knowledge of using Jira, Bitbucket and Github in collaborative environment
* Knowledge or experience with Kotlin a plus
* Experience in maintaining and releasing commercial apps in App store
* Experience working with third party SDKs, libraries and analytics tools
* Experience of A/B testing
* Strong networking experience – integrating with Restful Json APIs
* Degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent experience
* Fluent English skills

More about you…

* Fun loving personality is crucial!
* Highly value efficiency and understand the importance of writing clean code
* Ability to take charge of your time and prioritise tasks, as well as communicate effectively and recognise the value of collaboration between team members
* Passion about building something truly meaningful
* Entrepreneurial mind-set, able to generate ideas and new opportunities for growth
* Some start-up experience could be useful as well

Benefits of working at Monese:


* Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company
* A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible
* International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks
* Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well
* Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues
* In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities
* Flexible working schedule and possibility to work remotely
* Stock options and competitive salary

Sounds like something for you?


Then please send us your CV and cover letter. And be quick to apply, as we will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately.

If taking on a big part of the responsibility for making Monese the most innovative banking account in the world doesn’t scare you and you want to file patents not follow trends then read on…


We are looking for you, if you have:


* Proven commercial experience in iOS app development
* Experience working in an Agile environment, as well as with Xcode, Swift and iOS SDK
* Knowledge of using Jira, Bitbucket and Github in collaborative environment
* Experience in maintaining and releasing commercial apps in App store
* Experience working with third party SDKs, libraries and analytics tools
* Experience of A/B testing
* Strong networking experience – integrating with Restful Json APIs
* Degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent experience
* Fluent English skills

More about you…

* Fun loving personality is crucial!
* Highly value efficiency and understand the importance of writing clean code
* Ability to take charge of your time and prioritise tasks, as well as communicate effectively and recognise the value of collaboration between team members
* Passion about building something truly meaningful
* Entrepreneurial mind-set, able to generate ideas and new opportunities for growth
* Some start-up experience could be useful as well

Benefits of working at Monese:


* Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company
* A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible
* International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks
* Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well
* Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues
* In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities
* Flexible working schedule and possibility to work remotely
* Stock options and competitive salary

Sounds like something for you?


Then please send us your CV and cover letter. And be quick to apply, as we will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately.

At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.


The first Monese product already serves hundreds of thousands of customers in the UK and Europe, and we are adding new services on a regular basis.


Our fast growing team is located in London, UK and Tallinn, Estonia. The Role

You will be working on an interesting and varied development project, for an important end client.

You will have experience of building Android applications in Java and will have a good understanding of ‘object orientated’ software development.

The role is an excellent opportunity to work with one of the most recognisable IT organisations in the UK, working on with an important end-client.

Skills & Responsibilities

You will have experience of building Android applications, with Java using Android SDK
You have experience/strong understanding of object orientated software development

items.content:
iOS Developer

Posted May 18

Tablet Command
Headquarters: San Francisco Bay Area
http://tabletcommand.com
View all Tablet Command jobs →

Remote
Timezone Requirement: Pacific +/-1h, Australia (Melbourne +/-1h)

Description

Tablet Command is the emerging leader as an incident management application for public safety and emergency responders. The iPad app provides an intuitive, easy to use, robust application to public safety first responders for notification, situational awareness and incident management.

Tablet Command Enterprise Service is in use by thousands of fire service professionals spanning 100’s of fire departments across North America. Our premiere users include San Francisco, Stockton, Miramar (FL), San Bernardino County, San Diego City, Denver and San Mateo County.

Tablet Command is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and we work remotely - across multiple time zones. Preferred time zones are Pacific +/-1 hour and Australia (Melbourne) +/- 1 hour.

Requirements

The ideal candidate will be required to have remote experience (work from home or freelance/contract) and be located in the following time zones: Pacific Standard Time +/- 1 hour or Australian Eastern Standard Time (Melbourne, Sydney) +/- 1 hour.
The best candidate will have strong communication skills and a passion for mobile development, software engineering and great UX design, as well as an enthusiastic attitude and a willingness to learn and keep up with new technology and trends.
As a part of a small, collaborative and agile tech team, be a primary contributor to the design and development of new mobile applications and features. Build, test, debug and maintain application software throughout the product lifecycle. Additionally, this position will require a strong internal and external customer service commitment, and the willingness to be responsive to the needs of the team.

Please provide in your application an example of something you’ve created and are proud of. This can be anything you choose: an app you’ve built, some code, a blog post, a pull request, or whatever you like.

Nice-to-haves include:
  • 3-4 years of professional experience with iOS (Swift, Objective-C)
  • Knowledge of design patterns, data structures, and algorithms
  • Experience with RESTful API
  • Organized, ability to be self-managed and able to collaborate across team
  • Action-oriented, diligent, and flexible
  • Passion for public safety and mission-critical software

Benefits

We’re committed to Tablet Command being a company where the best developers want to work, so we run an operational system (with credit to Joel Spolsky) known as “making a company where the best developers want to work,” or, in simpler terms, treating people well. This operational system applies to the physical layer (allowing remote work, family-friendly policies, reasonable work hours), the presentation layer (clean and pragmatic programming practices, pushing decisions down to the team, hiring smart people and letting them get things done, and a commitment to inclusion and professional development). But most importantly, the human layer, where no matter what we do, it’s guided first and foremost by an obsession with being fair, humane, kind, and treating each other as family.

Here are some of the other benefits you can expect working for Tablet Command:

  • Opportunity to work on high profile apps that make a difference
  • Work with an awesome dedicated group of people who are passionate about technology and public safety
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Generous Vacation Policy

The Application

If you think we are a good fit for this position, please submit your resume along with a cover letter, letting us know why you want this job and why you are the best candidate for this positions.

Your resume will be reviewed, if selected, you will be scheduled for a first call/interview.  During this call, we will discuss your previous experience, and we’ll also have a couple of technical questions.  Beyond the first call, you will be expected to develop a small application (specs to be provided). The time expected to build the application is 4 to 5 hours.  Based on satisfactory performance in this phase of the process, you will be scheduled for a second call/interview which will include a code review and screen sharing session.  If selected, a conditional job offer will be presented that is contingent upon reference and background check.

Apply for this position

Send a resume to jobs@tabletcommand.com
